snippet: Scientists and casual observers agree that the storms that drenched Northern California over the winter left butterflies in short supply this year, vastly limiting one of spring's most beautiful spectacles.   Arthur Shapiro, an entomologist at the...
lead_paragraph: Scientists and casual observers agree that the storms that drenched Northern California over the winter left butterflies in short supply this year, vastly limiting one of spring's most beautiful spectacles. Arthur Shapiro, an entomologist at the University of California at Davis, said he had never seen so few butterflies. He estimated that the population was less than 10 percent of normal.

headline.main: Butterflies in Short Supply in California
